alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 2:17PM PST until January 03 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches of snow likely. May see localized greater amounts on higher terrain above 1000 ft. Breezy east winds with gusts around 20 to 30 mph may create patchy blowing snow conditions with reduced visibility. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From noon Sunday to 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be challenging at times. Gusty winds will cause blowing snow which may reduce visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will transition to rain on Monday morning.
info.instruction: Keep an eye on the forecast for updates on the situation. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when travelling. Practice your winter safety rules. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your car in case of emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
